messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Re: Re:Chain Mail and wire

messages.messageBody:
----- Original Message -----
From: <KathrynJB@...>

**He's also planning
to put together kits of tools and supplies to sell for people who want to
keep playing after the funshop.**

Good idea! I won't worry about bringing anything then.

Kelli~

messages.subject: Re: Re:Chain Mail and wire
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 5/22/2003 12:06:06 PM Eastern Standard Time, ... Well, Julian will bring along tools to use in the funshop. He s also planning to put
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 5/22/2003 12:06:06 PM Eastern Standard Time,
AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com writes:

> This all sounds very cool to me,
> what type of tools would I need to bring to be part of this funshop? Or
> would the tools be provided?
>
>

Well, Julian will bring along tools to use in the funshop. He's also planning
to put together kits of tools and supplies to sell for people who want to
keep playing after the funshop.

Kathryn


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: RE: [AlwaysLearning] Re:Chain Mail and wire
messages.msgSnippet: I haven t tried 14, but I did some work with galvanized 16 when I first started - OUCH! I want to copy the mail designs with my 20 gauge sterling, which is
messages.messageBody:
I haven't tried 14, but I did some work with galvanized 16 when I first
started - OUCH! I want to copy the mail designs with my 20 gauge sterling,
which is much easier on the hands :0). ~Rue


>>>>
Well, Julian tends to work in 14 or 16 gauge galvanized steel! Maybe he can
show you the macho stuff, and you can show him what he could do with the
lighter stuff.

Kathryn
